communication.label: My Phone Number
communication.description: SMS me as I might be busy

communication.label: My Gmail
communication.description: This is the best way to get in contact

career.about:
Look no further if you are after a creative developer who has a long history in the digital industry and is constantly pushing the boundaries with new tools and methodologies.

I would best describe myself as an **ES6** and **PHP** developer with a wide range of skills and experience across multiple technical, creative and business skill-sets.  I believe in approaching each digital problem by using a number of various technologies according to their strengths, industry track record and appropriateness for the problem at hand. My frameworks of choice are generally **ReactJS** (ES6) and **Laravel** (PHP) however I do have experience across a number of different frameworks and platforms such as **Symfony**, **WordPress**, **ExpressJS** etc. While I actively work across a broad range of digital disciplines, I do currently have a special focus on exploring single page application development using **ReactJS** and **Laravel**.

Development may be my strength, but problem solving is my passion. To me, problem solving is not limited to development alone. Creative and UX is a discipline that I actively pursue and, I believe, it makes me a better developer to lead and contribute in these areas. I greatly respect creative experts and I strive to contribute, enable and learn from graphic and UX professionals with whom I have the privilege to work alongside with. I believe that by having experience working across creative and technical makes me a better developer with a greater capacity to provide workable digital solutions.

Finally, there is more to what I can offer than what I can fit into this small introduction. I invite you to browse my portfolio, or chat with me directly, to better gauge my ability and experience in digital development, leadership, creative and mentorship. Working together, I am sure we can learn, implement, monitor and improve digital solutions to solve almost any problem.

projects.label: PHP Fission Schema
projects.summary: Fission aims to provide an easy to understand set of concepts and tools for handling the creation and manipulation of nested array data which can be built into any framework. These tools include object schema building, value sanitization, value validation, value manipulation and, most importantly, role and scope based property access control.

projects.label: React SPA Boilerplate
projects.summary: This repo is a simple tool I use to introduce people into the world of react single page application development. The aim is to include all of the basic tools, scripts and processes needed to create a basic react spa application. If you spot something that can be improved, or think that something can be added to better achieve best practice then please contribute!

projects.label: Tutelage
projects.summary: The aim of the Tutelage project was was to create a suite of tools and platforms to standardise the educational content authoring and purchasing process to make it easier for all involved. We wanted to reduce the gap between authors, experts and educational institutes by providing an easy to use platform for educational institutes to create learning and assessment tools seamlessly using content from multiple authors

projects.label: Tappr Dashboard
projects.summary: Tappr is a payment technology redefining the payment experience. Say goodbye to confusing fees or difficult systems and hello to your money moving in the right direction. My involvement was to continue development of the React driven web dashboard to meet the feature roadmap deadlines and to implement solutions to challenges as they arrived.

projects.label: WordPress Boilerplate
projects.summary: This project aims to provide a simple to use boilerplate for WordPress by bringing in multiple modern web technologies for client side, server side and hosting. This project approaches WordPress from a professional development perspective and is aimed at developers. It is not intended to be used by non developers or people new to WordPress. It is designed to create a philosophy for modern WordPress development using NodeJS, composer, docker and be continuous integration ready.

projects.label: ACF Fusion
projects.summary: This project aims to provide a standard programming interface with the popular WordPress advanced custom fields plugin. Field groups are created and managed programmatically without the use of the graphical frontend or acf json files.

projects.label: Vielo
summary: Contracted to convert externally designed layouts into a custom WordPress theme.
Built platform using WordPress fusion and Docker Boilerplate.
Used ES6 and webpack to create JS and SCSS driven theme.
Used ACF to create a modular theme similar to concepts used for laravel blade templating.

projects.label: The Marketing Lab
summary: Contracted to convert externally designed layouts into a custom WordPress theme.
Built platform using WordPress fusion and Docker Boilerplate.
Used ES6 and webpack to create JS and SCSS driven theme.
Used ACF to create a modular theme similar to concepts used for laravel blade templating.

projects.label: Direct To Home
projects.blurb: Working onsite at DTH media’s offices in New Farm, I worked on creating a modern set of digital tools for this Brisbane based startup.
summary: Contracted to scope, develop and manage a custom web application using WordPress.
Worked in house for 3 months to design and develop the web application.
Web application uses the WordPress boilerplate and ACF fusion projects.
Heavy use of Google Maps API and geo searching to display delivery zones using polygons on a map.
Project is deployed to and hosted within a docker swarm environment.

projects.label: Docker Swarm Environment
summary: Researched, budgeted and purchased bare metal equipment to create a production ready server environment.
Built bare metal servers from individual hardware components and supervised software configuration.
Deployed a production docker swarm within a visualized environment using rack resources and AWS cloud services.
Hosted and maintained a number of products and supporting services within the swarm.

projects.label: Fit4Duty Portal
summary: Assigned the task to scope and develop a SaaS drug testing portal.
Requirements included a single page Angular 2 application with shared code base across browser and iOS devices.
Worked closely with stakeholders to scope requirements and identify market opportunities.
Programmed Symfony driven API with Angular 2 SPA frontend.
Used PhoneGap to deploy on mobile devices.

projects.label: Healthy Staff
projects.blurb: I worked with the startup company Healthy Staff to develop a simple WordPress website aimed as a jump off point for their future digital marketing ideas.
projects.summary: Healthy staff is a simple WordPress website created using a mixture of standard WordPress plugins (YOAST, ACF etc) and Visual Composer. The layout was created entirely with Visual Composer to allow for customisation of any design element on any page at any time. In addition to developing the theme I also developed the design concept and page hierarchy.
projects.description: Healthy Staff was the last project in which I used a purely Visual Composer approach for layout design. I had found the, what I thought at the time, restrictive way that WordPress approaches templating to be inefficient and difficult to work with. Coming from a strong symphony background I was used to twig templates allowing me to customize the look of pages with relative ease. After finding out about Visual Composer I manipulated the plugin to become a complete drag and drop page builder. It was during this project that I began to see the limitations of this approach and realize that there was a lot more to developing WordPress themes. Aside from that I had a great deal of fun working on this project. The major constraint was time and the client had a need to have the site ready and launched within a two-week period. I worked with a junior developer to research what other sites in the industry provided users as well as built up a good understanding of what the general look and feel was. The design and development process was rapid and we had a release candidate up within a week. The client, who is a client we have worked with on multiple times before, was happy and with relatively little changes we proceeded to launch.

projects.label: Drug And Alcohol Institute
projects.blurb: I worked with Drug & Alcohol Institute to develop a modern and friendly sales platform to advertise their specialist courses and take enrolment & payments online.
projects.description: The Drug and Alcohol Institute project was the first project that pushed me into learning WordPress. Before this time, I had mainly worked with Drupal 7 and Symfony however the client required that the final proposal included WordPress. The integration requirements for this project were extensive and it was now that I decided to build the Visual Composer Form Framework to provide the necessary custom logic to the various forms on the website. My research of existing form plugins such as Gravity and Ninja forms resulted in the realization that they were just not set up for heavy forms with advanced conditional logic. The final project resulted in a heavily customised WordPress platform with custom plugin and theme development as well as integration with Axcelerate, Xero, eWay and Vision 6. The site is fully responsive and built entirely using the drag and drop site builder plugin Visual Composer.
projects.summary: The Drug and Alcohol Institute website involved the development of a sales platform using WordPress and multiple integration features. The layout has been designed using Visual Composer with numerous custom visual composer plugins to bring integrated content from various third party providers such as Axcelerate. In addition to Axcelerate, eWay and Xero integration was built into the platform to allow for online payments and automatic invoice creation.

projects.label: Control Logic
projects.blurb: We teamed up with the guys at Control Logic to develop a WordPress solution with a special focus on a modern and impressive responsive design.
projects.summary: Control Logic challenged my CSS and layout skills and pushed me way outside of my comfort zone. It was a challenging project and lead me to improve some of the more advanced creative and design skills that I had not had exposure to as a primarily server side developer. It is a WordPress website with custom plugins and theme development. It is fully responsive and built within Visual Composer.

projects.label: Axiom College
projects.blurb: I worked with Axiom College over a number of years to deliver multiple iterations of their online sales & enrolment platform using Drupal and WordPress
summary: The current Axiom College sales and enrollment platform is developed using WordPress with a custom theme and a number of custom plugins to provide integration to the company FileMaker database. I worked with stakeholders to continuously develop the branding and theme to stay ahead of the curve. The site is fully responsive and was designed to handle large amounts of both templated information and bespoke landing pages.
Employed to managed the organisation’s digital projects.
In charge of scoping, planning, scheduling, development, deploying and monitoring digital applications.
Developed multiple iterations of the digital student portal system and sales website
Worked with heavily integrating the organisation's FileMaker database into every digital project.
projects.description: When I first started at Axiom college during 2012 they had a custom solution in place with limited responsive and content management features. Over the following 6 months I embedded myself within the company and learned the processes and industry which Axiom College operated. Having come directly from a University background (Griffth) I was familiar with adult education but the VET industry was something completely new. I worked with the organisation’s sales and marketing manager to develop a new look within a Drupal 7 platform to replace the current limited system. The new Drupal 7 solution provided a far easier way for staff to add course material, better integration and better responsive features. Overall my goal was to develop something modern, scalable and flexible for the new marketing direction the company was heading. After two years of running the Drupal 7 system the requirements of the company had changed and they were looking for something easier and more straight forward for their staff to use for publishing and sales. It was decided that a move to a WordPress platform was the best choice as the administrative experience was more in line with the administration staff’s expectations. The current website was developed using Visual Composer with a custom theme and considerable plugin development to allow for direct integration with the company’s FileMaker database. The aim was to create a responsive and accessible platform that simplified the process for adding courses and content to the website. This was a considerable task given the complex amount of integration requirements which needed to be met in order for enrollments and course information to be communicated reliably and efficiently.

projects.label: Griffith University
summary: I was contracted at Griffith to assist with the jQuery scripting for the new main Griffith website.
My responsibilities involved development of the HTML/CSS, jQuery plugin development, third party jQuery plugin integration, social media integration, responsive design and some PHP development
I customised the universities CMS, a enterprise level CMS called MySource matrix by programming a custom dashboard to make content creation easier and smoother

projects.label: Cozmo Cards
summary: I was contracted to develop a custom online gaming system for multiplayer browser card games
Worked closely with professional card game pfeatures to learn the games, the strategies and the rules for 9 popular middle eastern games
Developed a custom object orientated PHP server-side API to manage game lobbies, individual sessions, game rules and AI decision making logic.
Developed a jQuery user interface to allow users to navigate the system, manage personal profiles, create and join games as well as play the actual games

projects.label: AJ Parkes Online Ordering Portal
summary: My first commercial position, I worked at AJ Parkes as the organisation’s web developer to develop and maintain the company website
I worked closely with the company’s management and board of directors to develop a new modern brand as well as created a customised eCommerce platform.
The platform featured an online drag and drop builder for customers to design their own custom name badges as well as eWay integration for online credit card processing.
